website_summaries.verdict: With its versatile design and extra battery, it's the best value from BLACK+DECKER for the budget conscious buyer who also wants to trim and edge without the limitations of a cord.
pros: In addition to the affordable price, owners are impressed with the lightweight construction, additional battery, and auto line advance that makes weed trimming and edging tasks virtually hassle-free
cons: Not quite as powerful as costlier models
The battery takes a while to charge, but having two batteries for the price helps when one is charging

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy the lightness of this string trimmer. Long lasting cutting cord and easy string advancement from the pistol grip. Works on 12" weeds for about 15mins,then 20volt battery gets slower&slows to stop in 31 minutes. Other batterys at higher capacity and less expensive are on Amazon... I didn't want to whack for extended time anyway. JB
customer_reviews.author: johntarz

customer_reviews.title: Batteries stink
customer_reviews.text: It took 3+ hours to charge each of the batteries after taking them out of the box. The, battery #1 lasted 45 minutes and battery #2 lasted 20 minutes, and got very hot. I used the less powerful setting with both batteries. The instructions say the batteries have no guarantee, and that I should go to a dealer with them, to do what, I don't know. I am not going to fool around with batteries when I have yard chores to do. I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: FullPlanet

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great if you have an incredibly small lawn with skimpy grass that you can trim in under 5 minutes. If you have a hearty grass like St. Augustine and need more than 10 minutes to get the job done, this thing is pretty much useless. You get under 10 minutes of run time (even on the increased run time setting) per battery, and the battery takes over 4 hours to charge. I was disappointed to say the least and returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: nolazep

customer_reviews.title: Cheap unit that doesn't auto-feed the line.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this trimmer. I have to stop every few minutes and take the line out and advance it... it will not auto-feed the line. I took it apart and re-wound the line but it made no difference. My old Black N Decker works better than this one. Seems like the put a cheap undersized motor in this as well. I wish I hadn't bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L. Hanner

customer_reviews.title: The good: it's light
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 3.5 stars if that were an option. The good: it's light, not noisy, doesn't vibrate like a gas trimmer, auto feed is convenient and the edging option is easy to convert to. The bad: it's not powerful (forget cutting something thick), the batteries don't last long ... At least you get two..., Edging isn't very accurate and will take some getting used to, the length of line you're allowed isn't large so cut radius is small and it's easy to bump the line feed accidentally. If you have a medium yard or bigger go gas. If you have something relatively small with no thick brush, get this.
customer_reviews.author: GKF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Recently had the chance to use this trimmer for the 1st time. I'm genuinely impressed with the ease of handling and use. I had my doubts as to whether this could handle some of my trimming and edging needs. It actually has enohgh power to cut through thicker grass clumps and weeds. The line feed feature is great and works well. A single battery lasted for all trimming and edging front and back. Battery didn't give up till the last bit was at hand. The edge trimming feature works perfect, a simple pull and twist motion turns it from trimmer to edger and back again. Lightweight, comfortable to use. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight, gets most of the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this rechargeable weed wacker. No, it's not as powerful as a gas one but I can't use a gas trimmer; they're too heavy! This is pretty light and does most of what I need it to. The battery does run out but I have a lot of them since almost all my power tools are B+D. I still need breaks as even this light thing causes pain (fibromyalgia and arthritis). Because of this, it's slow-gowing but there's progress! The line is auto-feed and doesn't tangle up so I LOVE it!! 4/5 stars because of power but I know I'm trading power for weight! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Misty May

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lithium Battery Weed Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand how anyone could write a negative review. This product works exactly as presented and I'm sorry I didn't purchase it sooner. For those that wrote negative reviews... they perhaps anticipated this weed trimmer to have the same power and versatility that a $350 trimmer would. This trimmer is for your home use and NOT commercial. I trimmed my full lawn area surrounding my home. Trimmed weeds and edged - this product (with a single string) works great! Good battery life also.
customer_reviews.author: ZymeAway

customer_reviews.title: After using the product only three times the Easy Feed stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After using the product only three times the Easy Feed stopped working. It was great when it worked, but now only about three inches of line is available. I cannot recommend this weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: TTU prof

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: My 40v version motor burned out after 5 years of heavy use. Got this one thinking it was a good deal. Should had paid the extra $50 and got another 40v. This one makes a 30 min job take 3 days (re charging batteries). If you ever used a 40v version the lack of power is greatly noticeable, only got to do the sidewalk before swapping batteries...barely 50 feet worth of sidewalk. Sadly I missed return period.
customer_reviews.author: Dennys N.

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: I have tall weeds on my backyard and hills. this trimmer works so slow that i have to return it. String comes out on one end rather than both ends.. I am much better off with my Hitachi Brush Cutter CG 22EA(SLP). This black and decker is in the minor league in terms of quality and performance. I have other Black and Decker Lithium powered product, all of which worked well. (Blower, , Chain saw). This was why I bought this one. A huge disappointment. If you have a lot of tall weeds to cut, stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Batteries die REALLY FAST
customer_reviews.text: Product is lightweight, and that is good. It is not very powerful, but that is to be expected with battery operated. The thing that bothers me the most is that each battery takes about 3 hours to charge and lasts about 20 minutes on power saving mode. If you have a tiny yard, this might be just fine for you. I have a one-third acre fenced yard with front sidewalks. To weedeat the house and fence and edge the driveway and the sidewalk will take about 4 days of charging one battery after another.
customer_reviews.author: Regina E.

customer_reviews.title: It works good, is nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Advertized that each battery would last 30 minutes. My neighbor and I bough one. It works good, is nice and light, but battery only lasts 15 min. Even returned one and it only lasted 15 min. also. I don't last longer than 30 min. so works for me. Glad I have 2 batteries. Shud maybe advise people interested to get one with a bigger voltage battery.
customer_reviews.author: sydsl

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: listed as "easy feed"--press button to feed string; but it fed string even without pushing button
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries won't charge
customer_reviews.text: 1st complaint: Battery charger does not work. This is useless without batteries. If I can't get a replacement charger, I would like to return the trimmer, but I don't have the original box. This is 2nd complaint on this product: So far we have had no response and are still waiting to hear from someone on this matter. It is pretty bad when we get a completely new weed eater with 2 batteries and the charger doesn't charge them up after first use. I feel that we should be sent a new charger because we paid for a working one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Try another brand.
customer_reviews.text: In less than three months of regular, non-heavy use, appropriate storage and recharging, the safety lock on this trimmer is already malfunctioning so you can't get it to run. I've been buying Black & Decker products for three decades -- including two trimmers that performed to standard -- and this is my last one. Amazon informs me my return window is closed, so I urge you to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Two Power Settings, Two Batteries and Manual Line Advance.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the need for the second battery. Even after doing my front and back lawns, I still have power to do more. There are two power settings on this and even on the high setting I could do the front and back lawns. But I have switched to the lower power setting all the time, because I find it gives better control when cutting grass, the only thing I cut with this tool. Also, the button for manual string advance is a plus and I was surprised to find a tool that offered it. With automatic string advance, you go through too much line, far too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: e whitestone

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have died
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July 2017 and subsequetly purchased the Black & Decker drill and hedge trimmer. I have a total of 4 B&D 20volt batteries and all of them are fine. But the LSTE525 String trimmer would not start when I went to use it the other day. Hate to order another one if it isn't going to last more than 2 seasons. It did work fine while I had it, although I was not crazy about the edger guide wheel. It tended to get in the way when using the regular string trimmer mode.
customer_reviews.author: GordonSt

customer_reviews.title: Maybe defective...sadly lacks power
customer_reviews.text: Previously used a B&D LTS220, one that came with the little mower deck although didn’t use deck much. I need a lightweight unit and the 220 was good for weight and power. I researched and decided that this one should be as powerful or maybe even little better than my old one but boy was I disappointed. The power is so underwhelming I’m thinking it must be a bit defective. I fully charged batteries so that’s not issue. I’m going to return and reorder and hope next one has some oomph to it. Before I bought this I tried to get repair parts for my old one but discontinued and couldn’t find parts....unit was only 3 or 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: misspiggy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It cuts really well. Light weight and quiet. The batteries only last about 20 minutes and take quite awhile to charge. I have now ordered 2 of the 3.0 batteries. That should give me plenty of work time. I had a Homelite 2 stroke that quit idling right after about 2 months. Then I bought a Craftsman 2 stroke that lasted almost a year. Couldn't remember where I bought the Homelite so just trashed it. Have tried to call Craftsman and email them because it is supposedly still under warranty but they don't answer the phone or respond to the emails. As long as this lasts reasonably well it is a much better option than gas.
customer_reviews.author: wej

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: As the pictures illustrate...not sure if they actually sent me a used one, claiming it was new as the box was taped up repeatedly on one side. Take it out and find cracked plastic where the protection cover is suppose to insert..Thus I can not insert it the cover much less utilize it. I've had the three in one mower from Black & Decker which I'd swear by. Bought this as the other died after 3 yrs. of heavy and hard use. Thought this new purchase would be good unfortunately not. Will see what solution is provide, even with the protection plan purchased. Will update post at such time.
customer_reviews.author: T.Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Read B-4 Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife; light weight, yes, and no extension cord. With full charge, batteries discharges if left on unit. Not sure if it discharges while removed. Working on that. I emailed Black-Decker and asked with NO reply. Directions say unit auto feeds if cord too short. Nope! Cord easily breaks and many times take apart required to rewind. No visual guide for edging, a pain, and must edge with full length cord except it breaks very often because of small size. Must use at #2 (full rpm) and uses battery quickly. Voltage too small and cord size also.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Passed my expectation
customer_reviews.text: After reading people’s reviews I had mixed emotions buying this but it passed my expectations. Super lightweight compared to gas ones. I have a neck and back problem and can not use a gas powered one because of the weight. This was easy for me to use and didn’t cause any pain afterwards. The battery life is okay not the greatest but not the worst either. I can get about 25 minutes on each battery on the level 1 setting. I don’t really need to use the level 2 unless it’s thick grass. One downfall they give two batteries and one charger. They should really give two chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Makes weed eating so easy!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this weed eater! I have never been able to trim our yard because of bulky over-sized trimmers that are heavy and hard to handle. Not anymore! I actually enjoy trimming the yard and I don't have to wait for my husband to do it any more. We have a little over 1/2 acre lot with lots of trees and we are able to trim the entire yard on 1 charge. Having the extra battery is convenient so we never have to worry about forgetting.
customer_reviews.author: D.Becker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is very easy for this 86 year old woman to manage. It is very light weight and the Battery seems to last well.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia Guckert

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to buy a gas edger and deal with the premix gas and weight of the gas model. I decided to give lithium battery a try. I've used this twice now, very happy, all lives up to my expectations. If I use the power level #1 (low) it does everything a home owner would want. Level #2 is more than you need for lawns and eats up the power too fast. The batteries last about 15-20 minutes on low, if you gauge your time and routine all is good. The batteries take about 3 hours to recharge. Overall I'd buy it again, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Makes wead eating a pleasure
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I used a wired B&D for years and found it tedious and something I largely avoided. The wiresless design and lightweight model make this really easy to use. The line feed works so simply. I love the wheel it has for edging and cutting against the wall of the house. I wish the batteries lasted longer but I am able to easily do my yard with two batteries that it comes with. B&D has done a lot of research to improve their tools and it shows.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Laplante

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use weed whacker!
customer_reviews.text: I never used a weed whacker before, didn't want the weight, the loud gas engines, the trouble and expense, the long extension cord etc., so I finally got this battery powered model. Works great! One screw to put in, meant 1 minute assembly! Adjusts easily to your height with telescoping arm, works great on the weeds, super lightweight and easy to use, and I ran it a half hour straight on one battery, which did not wear out yet, plus it has a charger and second back up battery so you could easily do long jobs with this. Super easy to use, and effective. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: RocketScience

customer_reviews.title: light weight easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Possible flaw with the unit: I had to edit my review and reduce my commendation of the unit. The trimmer comes with a button to extend more trim line when needed. However as another customer indicated, each time I release the trigger, then engage it again trim line is automatically dispensed and cut off even though there was full line length extended to the trimmer edge. This causes unnecessary waste of trim line and uses it up much too quickly and certainly negates the need for a line extender button. This is unfortunate as in every other way I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Singrae

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product
customer_reviews.text: On low speed (which is basically for light trimming) you will get about 30 minutes use on a charge. On high speed it will last about 20 minutes. I have a hill in my backyard which I only need to cut once a year after the rain. I tried it at both speeds in 18" high weeds and got no wear fast. I wait a month until all the weeds were dry and brown. It only worked well on high speed. It's not too heavy and it is easy to assemble and use. I know I should have probably ponied up for a more powerful unit but I couldn't justify it in my mind for a once a year application.
customer_reviews.author: SCC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is perfect for me. It’s light weight and easy to handle; it effectively trims around my fence and flower beds, and the wheel makes trimming around the curbs and sidewalks super easy. It’s not for super heavy duty weed eating, though, and the batteries only last for about 25 minutes each. Fortunately the trimmer comes with two batteries so that isn’t a problem for me. On the plus side, the batteries charge quickly and hold their charge for at least a week or so when not being used. During the growing season, I trim once a week, so that works out fine for me as well.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: "Black and Decker" tells you it's a quality product. I already had two products that shared the battery pack, and this model came with two batteries!!! Worth noting is that it doesn't have the power my gas-powered trimmer had. If your grass edging hasn't been cut in awhile this unit will have trouble getting through the thick grass, even at the higher power setting. But if you trim regularly, this is perfect. And the guide wheel helps make straight cuts, and takes strain off your back. Overall, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Cincy

customer_reviews.title: Adequate.
customer_reviews.text: It works well if you have only small jobs or carry extra batteries. Having the extra battery is a necessity for anything outside of quick jobs. Expect about 20 minutes of sustained/effective use per battery. It is adequate for the purpose I bought it for; however, it will not replace my gas-powered models.
customer_reviews.author: A. deFinta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the average lawn
customer_reviews.text: Here is how this works. You buy this, and your neighbor with the gas-power mix weed eater questions your decision, even makes fun of you. His / her machine is designed to cut down brush and 4 foot tall weeds. But 99% of what you and your neighbor cut is bluegrass around a mailbox and fence. Your neighbor, who who are quickly realizing never really matured past high school and uses small power equipment to compensate for certain inadequacies, constantly borrow yours because it’s ridiculously easy to use and his / her’s gums up and is an overall pain in the keester. Some people just never learn.
customer_reviews.author: jenna smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this every week for 10 weeks on a lawn of about 2000 square feet, with lots of edge/trim work. It works great and is easy to use. I can't finish trimming my yards on just one battery, though. If the battery lasted longer, I would say this trimmer is ideal. However, as long as you buy the version that comes with two batteries, you'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol G.

customer_reviews.title: Good So Far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing now for a couple of months. It's not as strong as a gas powered weed eater so if you need to chop some serious weeds, this one isn't for you. Having said that, I have a half acre yard that it handles beautifully. I usually do have to move to the second battery near the end, but, it comes with 2 so why not? I have no complaints. It's light enough that I can do the bank at the edge of the road with one hand, has enough power to eat through the stuff I can't get to with the riding mower, and lasts long enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Brown

customer_reviews.title: This is not a great edger
customer_reviews.text: My previous black and decker 20 volt trimmer/edger finally died so I bought this one because I loved the previous one, which I can't find anymore (of course) and I already had two 20 volt batteries from it which I could use with this one. This is not nearly the same as my previous one. The batteries don't last nearly as long (glad I have my old ones) and the line doesn't last any time for edging (which is odd because I used the same line in my previous one), it works ok for trimming, but don't buy this for the edger if you have very much to edge, might try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer head quit spinning after less than a week of use
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Easy to switch between edging and weedeating. Did a pretty good job with edging- the wheel really makes it easier to guide. Isn't good with tough grass, but it has been a while since I have edged, and it was a tough job. Started weed-eating my backyard, and it the head suddenly stopped spinning. There is no troubleshooting information in the manual for this. Chatted online with Black and Decker. Sherri said it had to be serviced. So, I guess that's where I'm headed next. If you purchase this, KEEP YOUR PROOF OF PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: C. Haney

customer_reviews.title: Average at best
customer_reviews.text: This weed eater is ok. It's light so my wife can use it while I mow, but it's got very little power and the batteries don't last very long. Also, despite them both being black and decker, it uses completely different size batteries than my other black and decker battery-powered tools which is somewhat annoying. You can almost certainly get a better weed eater for the same price if you keep your eye out.
customer_reviews.author: Cari and Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this!
customer_reviews.text: Just wish I'd bought it sooner, as I'd been fighting with my former one for years. The old one never fed the string properly, so I was constantly taking the whole spool apart and rethreading it. Plus it went through string like hotcakes! This B & D trimmer feeds string like a dream with the push of a button, and I only had to use the feed 3 times, doing a large yard with LOTS of trimming. Hence my string will last MUCH longer, and it's now a breeze to do my trimming instead of high stress/aggravation chore!
customer_reviews.author: DONNASANDY

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a weed whacker to weeds and grasses under control at our mountain home near Big Bear, CA. I bought this one because I have other Black and Decker tools that use the same batteries. So, I can keep working by switching out batteries. However, the auto feed mechanism broke after only a few months of using. Now I have to use pliers to pull more string out when I need it. So, I can still use this unit but I paid extra for the auto feed feature that doesn't work. I'd probably spend a little more and get a better quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Light and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I had the 18v version of with only one battery and it was such a headache. With this 20v one, the batteries still don't last a very long time, but because this comes with two batteries you're all set to go. You can charge one while you use the other. Very lightweight and easy to manage. I'm a woman and it is very comfortable for me. I would never be able to use those gas powered ones. They smell, they need oiling and refilling and they are so heavy. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Swizylstik

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as my old B&D trimmer/edger
customer_reviews.text: Tried it today, very disappointed! The string is not auto-pulled. I have to ended up uncovered the string cover and re-input the string for over 10 times within a hour work. Compared with my old B&D trimmer/edger, this new one isn't as powerful. It took me longer time to edged than my old B&D. Unfortunately, my old B&D trimmer/edger motor burnt out. Besides, my wrist feel more tired and hurt when used it. I may considered to return it. The battery only last 10-15 minutes. Terrible product! I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Ok product.
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this product the more I dislike it. I do not like the location of the safety switch. It makes my thumb numb holding it in and after using it for about 10 min. I think it gets too hot and does not work properly so we have a lot of start and stops. If I continue to use it we are going to have to by pass this safety feature. It is poorly designed for my small hands. I will probably just use another one.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Y. Folds

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd gone with gas...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, the weedeater itself is well-built and functions as intended and I can't, in good conscience, go lower than 4 stars for that reason. The issue is that the batteries don't last. In thick grass, I get an average of 20 minutes per 1.5 AH battery on low speed. The cordless tech just doesn't seem to be where it needs to be in order to be a serious-use tool. If you are doing light, incidental trimming, this may suit your needs. Otherwise I recommend either gas-powered or corded.
customer_reviews.author: T Chiasson III

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, POC
customer_reviews.text: This is a total piece of junk. It is cheaply made and string advancement button is a joke. I have an earlier version of this that is much sturdier and appears to be better made. It has bump system to advance string. I thought string advancement button would be nice feature. But it is a joke. Sometimes it advance the string, but most of the time it sucks it back into the spool and I have to stop and take spool apart and get it out. I went back to my original Black & Decker trimmer and put this thing in garbage. At least I got 2 new batteries. DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moeller

customer_reviews.title: left handle was defective
customer_reviews.text: This machine works OK, but the left adjustable handle didn't stay in the position and often moved while trimming/edging. It is cumbersome to return it so I fixed it using wire by myself. Now it stays in the right position permanently. I have liked Black & Decker trimmer/edger for a long time. But the 40 volt trimmer/edger I purchased late last year died recently. This new machine is a little defective. Black & Decker has to improve the quality of those machines.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. MUROYAMA

customer_reviews.title: It was a decent weedeater.... until it burnt up a year into owning it.
customer_reviews.text: After having it for a little over a year, was weedeating with it, and after running 2 batteries through it I started to smell something burning so I stopped. Only to realize it had burnt up and was toast. It was a nice weedeater but I was hoping to get a lot more life out of it. I wasn’t putting any extra stress on it than previously so I’m not sure why it burnt up. Safe to say I won’t get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: ethan allen freeman

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 of these trimmers and they are great but do not last long .. the last 2 lasted a year (they where the older model) but this one only lasted 2 months before the spooler head became so bend it wont even spin correctly and pretty much made the trimmer useless -- I wish they'd make them a little more durable ... we are thinking of going with a Kobalt Max trimmer now as these little ones have in theory been a waste of money (especially when they only last 2 months)
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Wood

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Trimmer.  Light and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my old Royobi 2 cycle beast. It's lighter and the battery lasts for my whole lawn / shrub trimming. Let's say when fully charged ... 30 minutes. The only issue is that it doesn't do a really good job on edging my driveway/sidewalk. It side trims the grass but doesn't dig the edge channel. Do not expect it to do a trenching job as that requires a metal trimmer. The auto string advance seems to work pretty well. In trimming mode the wheel acts as a nice distance guide when pushed against a fence or foundation. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Tallen

customer_reviews.title: I have to say this is one of the best purchases I have made in a very long time
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is one of the best purchases I have made in a very long time. As an older, single woman, yard work can be a real pain (lol) but this little thing made it a whole lot easier. It was simple to put together, one battery lasted through all of my trimming needs (about 45 minutes worth), it is lighter than the gas-powered or electric trimmers I've used and changing the spool (which I ALWAYS dread), is so stinking easy it's ridiculous. Absolutely LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: WholisticMom

customer_reviews.title: Look mom no plug
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade from my old plug in trimmer. It is adjustable so that I at 6'1" & my wife at 5'3" can find a comfortable length. Unlike old trimmer this serves dual use trimming + edging. The batteries can also be used for a very nice air compressor I have to fill bike/car tires & inflatable pool toys & a nice cordless drill I bought years ago.. Having 2 batteries turns out to be a key feature when using the high power mode which I use for edging. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Charge the batteries completely once you open the box. For an average suburban home with an average to large yard, this works great. My lot size is appx. 200'x60', chain link fence in the back yard, L shaped driveway. Edges my driveway and walkway very nicely. It will chop small vines and thin weed like trees similar to royal empress trees. If you expect to cut down a large amount of knee high grass, you will be let down. If you expect to maintain an average size yard, this is just right. Did not have any issues with the string feeding constantly as others have stated.
customer_reviews.author: DM467

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought a 40v instead!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight Adjustable handle Great for very light trimming of delicate grasses Charges quickly (also has extra battery) Cons: Weak power, can’t even cut through crabgrass and just kind of slaps it around Awkward to hold when trimming driveway Two step on switch is awkward and difficult to hold, keeps cutting off
customer_reviews.author: Peacebunny

customer_reviews.title: Easy for this old lady
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this item. I am 75 and able to do all my trimming with just one battery. My only problem is that one of the batteries I got with the trimmer will not charge. Will be contacting B & D for help. I did contact B & D and they told me to take it to a retailer for repair. Not so easy no one in this area will fix them and one cannot/willnot exchange. The warranty from B & D is two years and I also bought one from Amazon. No word as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Endicott

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for small yards and simple weed-whacking
customer_reviews.text: Limited power, average battery life lasts about 20-30 minutes. Works fine for small yards and simple weed-whacking. Edger works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you have a small yard and light trimming
customer_reviews.text: I did read the reviews and knew this is not powerful enough for some of the weed eating needed. Previous weed eater was same brand but twice the power- but it finally died. I also did not know to keep the ion batteries in the house during winter or they lose effectiveness or go completely bad. Could not pay the price for the 40V version and extra batteries, so making do with this 20v on areas where it will have enough power.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley N

customer_reviews.title: Great little trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Great little trimmer! I've used this now for cutting two yards, and couldn't be happier. I didnt use one of the batteries for almost a full year, and it was still fully charged after all that time. I've had no issues with line fouling and the Easy-Feed line comes-out and works perfectly as advertised. When buying a trimmer of ANY kind, you must keep these things in mind: How big is your yard. How much trimming will you actually need. WHAT are you trimming? This B&D is perfect for common grass, but it's NOT a brush hog. This is a great replacement for any gas trimmer, assuming that you need it for typical grass trimming.
customer_reviews.author: WV Radio Guy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews on Amazon about this weed whacker and since I had a couple 20 volt b&d 20 volt drills I decided to try this weed whacker and really liked the light weight and has good run time one battery lasted for the entire back yard which is fenced and plenty of flower beds so not to bad and it arrived early by one day
customer_reviews.author: LRay

customer_reviews.title: Not a great investment for me for the long run.
customer_reviews.text: It was a good trimme/edger... battery was good.... easy to change into different postions and change out the wire... I got it last summer because it was perfect for my small back and front yard. I stored it for the winter and when I took it out last week it was dead. =/ Sucks because I have other black & decker products like the chainsaw and hedge trimmer that uses the same 20v batteries.... But I'm going to try a diff company now and see how they are.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Edward Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer. Lightweight and has plenty of power for tackling the toughest weeds and grass. Battery lasts about 25 mins on cutting power number 1, I always keep another battery charged up in case I need it. The edging feature is a nice addition and the head rotates smoothly to allow this. The automatic line feed works well, so much nicer than a gas powered line trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Azman

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly as advertised. I received what I ordered; no surprises !
customer_reviews.text: Works well and exactly as advertised. Easy to use and maneuver around fences, flowers, posts, and all... The dual batteries was great, The 2 batteries has more than enough power to trim and edge the front + back yards with detail. My wife uses this with ease, the balance is good, along with performance. Very happy with this purchase, have been using for 2 months now and happy as the 1st day with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: John Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this guy! One battery usually lasts one whole trimming and edging! I don't have a large years, not a small one. I've also gotten into a pretty good routine. When I first got this, I definitely needed both batteries to get the job done. This is super easy to use. Fairly lightweight for my puny arms. I love that I can just twist this and it edges my yard!!! Very clean looking and easy to do! I will buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived quickly & I've used it twice, since then. The shaft can be easily shortened by the hand turning of a lock ring for storage, making it ideal to do so in small spaces. The batteries last surprisingly well between charges & the unit has plenty of power for cutting the healthiest of weeds, & grass. All in all, you can't do any better than this trimmer for it's abundant power, & fair cost. I highly recommend your trying it out for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: It last for sometimes less than 20 mins but the worst part is it takes more than 2 or 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given the product a higher grade but the battery is its downfall. It last for sometimes less than 20 mins but the worst part is it takes more than 2 or 3 hours to recharge. Sometimes I have to leave things I want to do with it for the next day sometimes, because of the time it takes the battery to recharge. I may have to get a gas one or consider buying 2 additional batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Brown

customer_reviews.title: MVP
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a godsend. We have a smaller yard, but requires a little more weed eating than average for its size because we use a reel mower for the majority of the lawn. Between the two batteries, this can usually take care of all the weed eating and edge around our walkways and flower beds. We've used it all season and we've got no complaints. Feeding the line is easy and switching from trimmer to edger is a snap (literally?)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Harper

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: 1st one broke within 2 weeks only having used it twice. I returned it and got a replacement. That one broke within 3 months after only 6 or 7 uses and is now beyond the return window so I am stuck with a broken unit. Worthless. It was the same issue both times it broke; the line head detaches/breaks away from the crankshaft and the engine will just whine but won't spin anymore. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Velvis Slag

customer_reviews.title: I did not expect much performance from a battery operated weed eater but this thing is pretty impressive for it's size
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised with the functionality of this weed eater! I did not expect much performance from a battery operated weed eater but this thing is pretty impressive for it's size. It uses .065 line vs .095 line that most gas powered ones do. It only has 1 feed where others have 2 feeds of line. However, it still works very well. It may not cut down some of the things that much more expensive options can but for your basic weed/grass trimming, this will work just fine. Very easy to hold and operate.
customer_reviews.author: B. Musgrave

customer_reviews.title: Great for older women!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 64 year old woman who has just recently become responsible for the outdoor yard work. I bought this trimmer because I was hoping it would be lighter and easy for me to maneuver. It performs well for me. It was easy to learn how to use it. The battery lasts long enough for me to get all my trimming done. I will say that my arms get very sore after trimming but that is because I am not used to doing the yard work and I think I will build up some strength as I continue with it.
customer_reviews.author: mjshaffer

customer_reviews.title: This is not a commercial whacker
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job around the house and lawn for me. The string is on the lesser side for me. I still have a real old Craftsman single whip that could kill a tree I think. But the B&D gets the job done after mowing. As I have aged it being light is a plus. It also uses the same 20V batteries used on my other new lawn care items I have bought from B&D. The string issue is the only thing I worry about. It does appear to use more string than I would like per use. The button to extend the string is a great idea. But I feel I bush it more than I would like.
customer_reviews.author: NRR

customer_reviews.title: Lighter, Quieter and Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used a gas trimmer for years, I wanted to get away from the gas and weight of that trimmer. Did our homework and for the price and weight, I thought I'd give it a try. I wasn't disappointed when we received it, immediately I removed it from the box and started using it immediately while one battery was being charged. The trimmer and edger is everything I need to make my yard look well manicured.
customer_reviews.author: PMT

customer_reviews.title: Freedom from an extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an electric trimmer for over 20 years. Finally got tired of using an extension cord. This trimmer is very powerful. I can do my front and back yard with one battery. Nice that it comes with 2 batteries. The automatic line feed is a nice feature. If you don't have a lot of land, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good but ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product mainly because it came with two lithium batteries and such a good price. The battery was partially charged when purchased, but then either battery would correctly charge. Before deciding to send it back I took both batteries and the charger to a a Black and Decker authorized repair store. The found the problem to be the charger and replaced it for free on the spot. I’ve had no problem since. A bit of inconvenience to have to go find a repair shop but better than returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value.....
customer_reviews.text: This tool fit my needs quite nicely. To my pleasant surprise it uses the same size/type battery as my leaf blower so I have 3 batteries and 2 chargers to use as needed. But one fully charged battery did my entire lawn with quite a lot of trim work around planters, etc. The ‘low power’ setting seemed too weak to cut well at the same pace I walk. The ‘wheel’ seems to impair my working visual field and I may just remove it. The string feed worked and the package is very lightweight. If it gives me 4 years of thrice weekly mowing I will be most happy.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Black

customer_reviews.title: Light but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift from my husband. He absolutely loves it. The edger function is very easy to use, and the whole product feels really sturdy while also being very lightweight. Our yard is about 1/5 of an acre, but very overgrown, and he was able to get through it on one battery. I'm really glad that I went with this one, rather than a gas powered trimmer, because this one is light enough that I can actually use it!
customer_reviews.author: Caro Fish

customer_reviews.title: This is my third unit to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I broke my last model by mistake. Ordered the latest model. The batteries and cord fit! Bonus. This model has several improvements. Button for cord advancement! Better handle design. Has two power settings! The battery life lasts just the right amount of time then I am glad it had died..........done enough work for today. Folds down, fits in my little truck, travels well for when I clean the family cemetery plots. Very valuable purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this weed eater because its lightweight and the shaft is adjustable for a short person like me or a taller person like my son who helps me with the yard. I dont have a lot of strength anymore and I wear out easily since I had radiation so the battery life is perfect. Also the handle is adjustable so that also is a plus and I can change hands if I need to if I start to get tired but still have battery life and weeds to remove. I cant say enough about how this weed eater is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over older cordless models.
customer_reviews.text: Love this trimmer As a woman over 70, I found my old one bulky and hard to handle. I was constantly bumping it to add string. This one is lighter, adjusts to my short stature and self feeding. I bought an extra battery pack so that I don't run out of charge before the battery is dead. The charging system is easy to use.If I can use it, anyone can. Update: After using it maybe three or four times it stopped working. Batteries are fully charged, but the thing refused to start. I guess I'll be returning it. Darn! I really liked it!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthy 625

customer_reviews.title: Make the change
customer_reviews.text: I have always used gas powered units but this was a pleasant surprise. I have a fairly large yard and was worried about battery life but have been extremely satisfied with this due to it being very lightweight and the battery is ok, I need them both to do my yard proper but my arms are thanking me
customer_reviews.author: Onlyino

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is just as effective as a gas weed eater for my yard. I needed something lightweight and this is perfect. The battery life is long enough to weed eat, but I have to change the battery when I edge my driveway. The only thing that I would change is to install a battery level indicator. When the battery dies, it stops without warning. Other than that, I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mya

customer_reviews.title: Great for women especially
customer_reviews.text: I happen to be female. I do the outside landscaping of our house most of the time. On multiple occasions couldn’t start the gas powered one we own, so I would borrow our neighbors battery powered one. Most stores either can’t beat Amazon’s price and or don’t have it in stock. Mine was 2/2. I was looking for a quality product, Multiple batterie, and charger. This includes 2 batteries, one charger, string, and the product itself. Batteries charged in about an hour from the box. I am happy
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a second gen of the trimmer I bought several years ago. Many improvements. Battery is not as heavy. New string advance works as well as the one before but totally different. Battery naturally never lasts as long as you think it should, but am happy with time. Easy string loading and easy removal of cartridge. All in all a well done trimmer. The second battery is good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gravitt

customer_reviews.title: I had this ONE YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in March 2019. Worked great for the entire summer/fall. When weed whacking season was one, I took out batteries and hung the trimmer on a hook. Yesterday I charged the batteries, put one on the trimmer, and nothing worked. I tried the other battery, it did not work either.
customer_reviews.author: xxx

customer_reviews.title: Good for yards, not for brush or tough weeds
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works fine for regular lawns, but I doubt it would be up for clearing tough weeds or any kind of brush. It's good for quick hassle-free trimming of your lawn. Pros: Lightweight, well-balanced. No-hassle cordless operation. Affordable. The wheel works well for edging. I like that you can easily reverse the trimming head for edging and shorten or extend the pole below the handle. Cons: Not for really tall people. Underpowered for anything other than lawns. Short battery life, about 25 minutes. For what I use it for, it is sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lundquist

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this except the battery life. I ordered a 3rd battery and it takes all three to do what my 18v Black and Decker did on two NiCad batteries. This one is lighter and does a better job on the sidewalk trimming. Just wish it had a better battery. 3 and a half stars is a better rating, but I tossed a coin.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stegall

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my B&D string trimmer. It is perfect for my small yard giving me the "manicured" look after i mow. A very good feature is the push button line feed on the handle, no more banging the bottom to try to extend the line. It also comes with 2 batteries so I am never without power. It is light weight and is very good for homeowner. Easy to use and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Tommyray

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love this model. It is much better than the 40 lithium battery model (same brand) which I also have, because it is much easier to handle. The adjustable shaft is great for me, since I am short and can adjust it to fit perfectly. It does not hurt my arm like most trimmers do. The shorter battery life is just fine - it lasts as long as I do! Having two batteries is so convenient; one is always fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: punacat

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last all that long
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed all the way around. Easy to set up. Easy to change up. Comes with two batteries which is nice. The only problem I have with it is the battery life. Maybe my expectations are too high, but to edge my front yard it takes two full charges on each battery to get through it. So I start in the morning, and try to finish up in the afternoon/evening. That said, I do like the product but if I had it to do over again I'd probably just go with a corded model.
customer_reviews.author: Kp

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This weedwacker/edger is fantastic. The 1st time I used it I had to go to the 2nd battery to finish up but only because the grass was so overgrown. The 2nd time I used it I was able to get all the edging and the leaf blowing done with one battery. Love, love this weedwacker. Now I'm more likely to do it every week as before with my old electric one maybe once a month. Liked it so well I ordered the leaf blower to go with it. Gave my old ones away. Let them fiddle with the extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: When I received the trimmer I charged the batteries right away. I was fully expecting to use both batteries the next day. I have a small yard but I was easily able to trim the driveway (50 ft long) and front side walk. Then still have enough battery life to do around the house on one battery. It is is very light and cut some thick weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Cory S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality trimmer.  Easy to use with long lasting batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works very well. With the wide cutting path, it is easy to quickly trim around gardens, buildings, and other obstacles. The batteries each last for 20 minutes or more of constant trimming. My only complaint is that the battery is at the end of the handle which makes this trimmer more cumbersome to use than the previous version of this model which had the battery further forward where the weight is more evenly distributed .
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Lawn looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received it last week and used it for the first time... did all the trimming in front and backyard on less than one battery’s power and run time. Not a bad deal, so far. I’ll update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Theatrefan

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an electric Black+Decker trimmer. It is lightweight and so easy to use. The battery lasts for at least a 1/2 hour of continuous use. Having a second charged battery ready to go is an added plus. Trims better than the electric trimmer and you can do it quicker since there are no cords to mess with. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: The best part is that the head rotates so that you ...
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about an electric string trimmer, but my fears were for nothing. The best part is that the head rotates so that you can edge your front curb and around your beds for a real pro appearance. The first time I used it I went through both batteries since my beds needed edging badly. Now, one battery does all my trimming. Note that there is only string rotating around the head, unlike some gas powered ones with two string ends.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelMax

customer_reviews.title: I love it. The instructions are a lot of words ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this about 2 weeks ago. Now that I have finally figured out how to turn it on, I love it. The instructions are a lot of words but not very clear. If you run it on 2, the battery only lasts a few minutes. I remember reading this on another review so turned it down to 1. It did not change the weed cutting ability and this time the battery lasted a little over 15 minutes. Definitely run it on power level 1.
customer_reviews.author: sandy S.

customer_reviews.title: Lite duty only.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a lite duty trimmer. It’s only a single string unit so it cuts kinda slow, and you can forget any kind of heavy brush. It works great for what i need it to do though and the battery lasts longer than needed on most days. As soon as my budget allows, I’ll be upgrading to a two string unit so I can edge the lawn, and clear the heavy weeds along the back fence.
customer_reviews.author: bryan feige

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered, hard to use with small hands, short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to use if you have small hands as you have to push in and hold the safety switch at the same time that you are pressing the on switch. The regular batteries (I bought 2) only last about 10 min each. It won't cut weeds with a diameter as large as or larger than a pencil if they are the least bit dried. It is, however, very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: GrannieB

customer_reviews.title: Good for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Good for small yards which is what I was looking for. Great for trimming lawn next to house and along fences. It is not meant for large areas with heavy grass and weeds as it is single line and underpowered for thar purpose. I've had no issues with battery life though I can do all my trimming in about 10 minutes. Only complaint is it's a bit short ( I'm 6 ft tall ) and the weight is all in the cutting head so can be a little uncomfortable in the lower back but for 10 minutes work it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will Amazon correct the problem....
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday charged both batteries, which took an extremely long time, used them both, tried to charge them again and charger is still blinking after 3 hrs. The battery has a charge, but how am I supposed to how much? Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this edger/wacker!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this edger. I just put it through its paces with my south carolina lawn; it has been a month since I edged due to last edger malfunctioning. It handled things like a champ and the wheel made it beyond easy to keep the edge straight and sharp. Most the negative reviews seemed to be about battery life. Mine lasted about 20 minutes per fully charged battery at highest power setting, which is about what I expected. Make sure you follow the instructions and keep batteries plugged in and charging when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER LSTE525 20V MAX Lithium Easy Feed String Trimmer/Edger with 2 Batteries
product_meta.description: Style:20V String Trimmer KitThe BLACK+DECKER LSTE525 20V MAX Lithium EASYFEED String Trimmer/Edger + 2 Lithium-Ion Batteries is part of the 20V MAX System; 1 System - Endless Tasks. Power for your Style. This tool is designed for trimming areas of overgrowth after mowing, as well as edging along borders, sidewalks, and flower beds. It features the Power Drive Transmission which increases torque for more cutting power at the string, and the 2-speed control lets you choose between more power or extended runtime. It easily converts from trimmer to wheeled edger. This unit features EASYFEED which allows you to advance your line with the push of a button with no bumping required. It has a premium micro texture soft grip that provides comfort and control while using the tool, with adjustable height and handle for ideal user comfort. Cutting swath of 12 inches; Line Size - 0.065 inches; RPM - 5,500/7,200; Replacement Spool - AF-100. Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts. Nominal voltage is 18. Includes: (1) LSTE525 20V MAX Cordless Trimmer/Edger, (2) LBXR20 20V MAX Lithium Batteries, (1) Charger, (1) AFS Spool, (1) Guard.
feature_bullets: Converts from trimmer to wheeled edger; Amp Hour : (2) 1.5 Ampere Hour
Power drive transmission for increased torque
Easyfeed allows you to advance your line with the push of a button with no bumping required
Part of the 20V MAX System; 1 system endless tasks. Power for your style

Part of the POWERCOMMAND Family of tools EASYFEED, POWERCUT, POWERBOOST helps solve common user frustrations when using Outdoor Power Equipment. Included Components: (1) LSTE520 20V MAX* EASYFEED TRIMMER, (2) LBXR20 20V MAX* Lithium Batteries, (1) LCS1620 Charger, (1) Guard, (1) AFS Spool; Power Source: Lithium Ion
2 speed control for more power or extended runtime. Line Diameter : 0.065 inches. cutting swath 12 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,087 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
